Mackenzie Williams was still behind, waiting for something. She was on your list of students to sleep with before they graduated. Her brother had been large for his age, but when push came to shove, you prefer a mare to a stallion. Although you loved both. "Yes, Ms Williams? Do you have a question for me?" you asked. "Yes, Miss." she rose to her feet. "And how can I assist you?" you enquired in your most seductive voice, moving away from your desk. You saw her nervousness, that convinced you that a sapphic experience was coming your way. "I am thinking about taking psychology in college. And I need a volunteer for an experiment. As you put it back, another mask catches your eye. In fact, you're sure that it winked at you, but how could a mask wink? It's a cute pixie face with short black hair and seems almost androgynous like it could be either a girl or boy, and it looks pretty life-like even sitting on the shelf. You look closer and see that it has little irises in it like contact lenses that are a florescent green, not the usual green.

That intrigues you, so you pick it up and look inside. It's a full head mask that has tiny colorful tattoos on the cheeks and around the neck. They shimmer like wings fluttering so you can't quite tell, but it looks really neat.

"How much for the short, dark haired one?" you call out.

"Oh, that's a very special mask. She's a bit tricky," he starts then pauses as if thinking. "I guess that one would be 20."

You've only got ten, maybe twelve, so you tell him, "That's a bit much for me. Anything here closer to ten?"

As you start to put it back, he replies, "Well, since it's your first purchase, I'll let her go for ten as long as you promise to let others know about the store."

Holding it back up, its eyes seem to sparkle at you, and the mouth has a smile as if it's saying it'd like to be with you. You can't spend too much more time looking since you have to get home, but is just having a mask going to be enough for the party?
